5.5.004 Released

Nov 30

posted by Raymond Camden in BlogCFC | 6 Comments

This release includes:

  • "Official" release of the tabs.
  • A fix for all you crazy folks who dare to format your dates in a non-American format. Don't you know that your aiding the terrorists???
  • Image browser. This is a link on the entry editor that opens a pop up window. You can then browse your images folder and pick an image to insert. It's like the Upload and Insert Image thing - just for your existing images.
  • For CF6 users - please note that you can only use a locale that maps to a locale supported by CF.
  • Small fixes here and there and of course a bit more cowbell.

Enjoy. This is the first release in a month, and most likely the last one of the year. I've promised myself I will get Canvas 2 and Soundings 2 out by Christmas.

This entry was posted on November 30, 2006 at 5:10 PM and has received 1478 views. There are currently 6 comments. Print this entry.

It would launch a popup and let you navigate your images folder and select an image to insert.

SVN Down

Nov 24

posted by Raymond Camden in BlogCFC | 5 Comments

As you may have noticed, SVN is down. First off - there is a new IP, and secondly, there is no hole in the firewall.

I'm considering simply adding my source to RIAForge. Anyone see anything wrong with that? It does mean the public won't get to see the history of files, but it does take one more IT task off my plate. (Although I manage RIAForge as well so it is just passing the buck from one hand to another hand.)

Podcast support concept

Nov 20

posted by Raymond Camden in BlogCFC | 10 Comments

I am considering adding podcast support to BlogCFC. My thinking is that it would be done like so:

  • Add a new file to the client folder, podcast.cfm.
  • This file will call a new method to get the last 10 entries where the attachment field is an audio file.
  • The XML is generated.
  • I will use the optional fields described here at Apple.
  • I will provide a set of CFSET lines on top for these optional fields. You would manually use these to modify the XML optional tags.
  • I will provide a CFSET you can use to specify a category, or list of categories, to filter the initial entry search too. This way if you use one blog category for your podcasts, it will be easier to grab.

This seems like it would get the job done - but I really don't like how manual it is. The flip side to this is that I could create a new podcasts table with all the options above. I'd then generate a URL for you to use and provide to Apple. The negative to that is that it requires a DB change, and we all know how folks don't care for that. ;)

This entry was posted on November 20, 2006 at 8:58 PM and has received 1757 views. There are currently 10 comments. Print this entry.

No comments?

Nov 17

posted by Raymond Camden in BlogCFC | 9 Comments

No one has yet posted about the new editor UI. Is everyone just too busy? Yes - I'm trying to guilt you. ;)

As an aside - I'm going to be adding a simple image browser to the editor form. So you can click a link, get a pop up window, and browse your images. When you find the one you like, it will automatically add the HTML to your current blog entry.

Tabbed entry editor

Nov 12

posted by Raymond Camden in BlogCFC | 5 Comments

Take a look at the tabs at ColdFusion Portal. I'm thinking of using this for the entry editor. By default you would see just the first tab. It would have the title, entry block, and category picker. Everything else would be in the second tag.

Thoughts? I know it isn't a big deal - but it bugs me that 90% of the entry form is skipped over.
